definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

pinyin: yuan2 yu3 yan2 xue2 yi4 shi2

sentences.english: Thus the paper is written in the meta-language of contradictory dialectic explanation.
sentences.chinese: 全文以矛盾辯證法爲元語言展開解釋。

sentences.english: A dramatic development in metalinguistic awareness occurs when children begin to learn to read.
sentences.chinese: 元語言意識的顯著發展要等到兒童開始閱讀纔會出現。

sentences.english: An ordered metalanguage is analogous to ordered logic.
sentences.chinese: 元語言是一個有序排列類似邏輯。

sentences.english: The platform has been likened to a meta language or language superset.
sentences.chinese: 這個平臺曾被喻爲元語言或語言超集。

sentences.english: Therefore these words are considered as the English meta-language.
sentences.chinese: 因此，這些詞彙就成爲英語中的元語言。

sentences.english: The development of a programming language involves the use of a metalanguage.
sentences.chinese: 開發一種編程語言涉及到使用元語言。

sentences.english: This kind of negation is metalinguistic negation.
sentences.chinese: 第三種情況叫做元語言否定。
